llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 23rd): Washington D.C. to New York City

* Depart from Washington D.C. in the morning
* Arrive in New York City by afternoon
* Check-in at a hotel in Manhattan (entire room)
* Explore Times Square and nearby areas
* Dinner at a nearby Italian restaurant

Day 2 (March 24th): New York City

* Breakfast at the hotel or a nearby café
* Visit the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island (optional)
* Lunch at a nearby seafood restaurant
* Visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art or the American Museum of Natural History
* Dinner at a nearby Chinese restaurant

Day 3 (March 25th): New York City

* Breakfast at the hotel or a nearby café
* Visit Central Park and the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
* Lunch at a nearby deli or sandwich shop
* Visit the Guggenheim Museum or the Whitney Museum of American Art
* Dinner at a nearby Mexican restaurant

Day 4 (March 26th): New York City to Ithaca

* Check-out from the hotel in Manhattan
* Take a train or bus to Ithaca (approximately 4 hours)
* Check-in at a hotel in Ithaca (entire room)
* Explore downtown Ithaca and Cornell University
* Dinner at a nearby Italian restaurant

Day 5 (March 27th): Ithaca

* Breakfast at the hotel or a nearby café
* Visit the Cornell Lab of Ornithology
* Lunch at a nearby diner or café
* Explore the Ithaca waterfront and nearby parks
* Return to Washington D.C. in the evening (approximately 4 hours)

Budget Breakdown:

* Transportation: $1,000 (train tickets from New York City to Ithaca, and bus or train back to Washington D.C.)
* Accommodation: $2,500 (3 nights in Manhattan, 1 night in Ithaca)
* Food and Beverage: $5,600 (dinners at various restaurants, breakfasts and lunches at hotels or nearby cafes)
* Total: $9,100

Note: The budget is based on a group size of 7 and may vary depending on individual preferences and exchange rates.
